body:
+1 

I'd like to expose MlFlow from behind an Nginx Server, with an application path `/mlflow` and the hard-coded references to `$HOST:$PORT` disallow this.

It should be fixed by removing the leading `/` from the JavaScript calls. To fix this, I'm sadly missing documentation on how `mlflow/server/js/src/sdk/MlflowService.js` is generated. This is not covered by `generate-protos.sh`.
@johnDorian do you know how mlflow/server/js/src/sdk/MlflowService.js is generated ?

Hello, I'm seeing some new errors with regards to trying to open mlflow in sagemaker notebook, see log below. The UI is opening up fine, but it doesn't show the experiments for some reason. Was anything changed recently that could be causing this? @smurching @harupy @dbczumar If yes, can this issue be please re-opened? Or should I create a new issue? 

```
2022/02/15 10:25:55 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/runs/search [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2073, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1518, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1516, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1502, in dispatch_request
    return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**req.view_args)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 238, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 298, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 539, in _search_runs
    request_message = _get_request_message(SearchRuns())
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 207, in _get_request_message
    request_json = _get_request_json(flask_request)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 177, in _get_request_json
    return flask_request.get_json(force=True, silent=True)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/werkzeug/wrappers/request.py", line 583, in get_json
    data = self.get_data(cache=cache)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/werkzeug/wrappers/request.py", line 424, in get_data
    rv = self.stream.read()
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/http/body.py", line 215, in read
    data = self.reader.read(1024)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/http/body.py", line 30, in read
    self.buf.write(next(self.parser))
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/http/body.py", line 58, in parse_chunked
    (size, rest) = self.parse_chunk_size(unreader)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/http/body.py", line 82, in parse_chunk_size
    self.get_data(unreader, buf)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/JupyterSystemEnv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/http/body.py", line 105, in get_data
    raise NoMoreData()
gunicorn.http.errors.NoMoreData: No more data after: None
```
I'm stuck on the same above issue as above ^^
